I've been a beta tester for about a year and was always a big believer in the promise of circle. It hasn't been a let down and I've been impressed with the progress that the team made from the first version. 

App has been really easy to use and the team has helped anytime I had issues. With young children and a teenager this has been the only way for me to keep tabs on what they're doing across devices. It's also been key in limiting internet usage at specific times on specific devices, etc. 

It's empowering for parents and an important tool for monitoring the network at home.

title: Grrrrr
text: I really wanted, I mean really wanted to love this app. My friends have it and they love it. I've had it for less than a week. Problem? First, it tells me that I have been on my email for five hours when I've only been at my computer for about an hour. Second, it's not always catching what my son is watching. Third, when I put safe search on my kid's and my computer, it completely blocked all of google, safari and Firefox. Fourth, it just completely lost everything. Everything. Won't even connect to my wifi. I've tried multiple ways to make it connect. Now I have no circle and no way to get it back. I've even tried start like I had a new circle box. The only NLT thing I did was to pause the internet this morning on my kid's computer via the app on my phone - which is the only place I have circle Disney set up. I am frustrated and upset.

title: I LOVE DISNEY CIRCLE!!
text: I love this Service! I have a 8 & 13 year old and each time they log on to their devices it notifies me. I monitor their X Box, PlayStation, Ipod, Ipad, and home computer with this app! I am able to see any sites they go on. I am able to set a time limits and pause their devices as well. I tested by adding my phone to be monitored and I could not log on to any adult content sites! This APP IS AMAZING! The service is amazing! I was able to add all these devices in minutes. And then whenever someone device is on our WiFi it immediately notify me and I can rather add them to be monitored or not. This is an amazing SERVICE! I am so happy I bought this.

title: So easy my grandma could use it
text:
I‚Äôve been looking for a solution in this space for some time.  When I came across the Circle Home product I was intrigued, and being accepted as a Beta Tester let me get my hands on the product early.

Setup was a breeze!  You plug the Circle Home in, connect it to your Wifi (or with a cable to your router), configure it with the app and that‚Äôs it!

I write software for a living, and when looking at other products I found that they were either too painful to configure or too easy to circumvent.  The Circle Home is neither of those.  Thank you Circle for using your Tech-Fu for good!

title: Disappointed
text: I bought the Circle when it first came out, worked great and I never had a problem with it. Then I upgraded my router to an expensive Netgear Orbi and I thought it was worth it because it had Circle built in. It doesn‚Äôt work properly and support has not been helpful. They actually asked me if I knew the game my son was playing was an online game (implying I don‚Äôt know the difference). When he hits his time limit, sometimes it cuts him off and sometimes it lets him keep playing. It‚Äôs infuriating. Ive lost control over the internet in my house. I tried to go back to the old Circle but it keeps fighting with the new router even though I disabled the parental controls. You guys need to support your product better!

title: Big Help Setting Time Limits
text: I have 3 children from 7-14 years old. I like how Circle allows me to create a different profile for each child.  The app gives you a breakdown of what websites or type of websites they visited. I didn‚Äôt realize how much time they were spending on their devices until I started using this!  This has been extremely helpful for me to limit their online gaming and video watching time. I was able to limit the time one of my kids spends on an online gaming website - much to my kiddo‚Äôs dismay! Haha. I had to take off 1 star because you can only assign 1 one profile which makes it harder when the kids are sharing the same computer.

title: Excellent product
text: I've tried several devices and services to manage my kids' Internet usage over the past couple of years and Circle is the best by far. The app could use some refinements, but overall I'm very pleased with the level of control and reporting. Initially, I hesitated to buy Circle because I have 1 Gbps internet service and Circle warned that it could slow down my connection. I was also concerned about reports of incompatibility with my eero network. Fortunately, neither turned out to be an issue for me and my Circle device has been working flawlessly for more than a month.

title: Good with a giant asterisk
text:
This works great for young kids. Once you hit teenagers then it is much more frustrating to get settings that are appropriate. School filters are one challenge. But here is the biggest issue in our house. Managing exceptions‚Äîrewards. You can set up weekdays and weekends with different settings. Great. BUT the app is not smart enough to open to the appropriate settings. It always opens to weekdays even on the weekend. If I am reviewing settings on a weekend it should default to weekends. It will allow you to make changes but not give any warnings that the changes you just made will not help you today because you didn‚Äôt select weekends. üò° 
It undermines the trust of the child with the parent. ‚ÄúDad. You said that you gave extra time. ‚Äú
‚ÄúBut I did!‚Äù 
Gotcha!  Nope. Burned by poor app design.

title: It‚Äôs something
text: I read all the reviews about it supposedly being hacked,  I don‚Äôt think people know what that word really means.  I read how it slows down the internet, again the internet doesn‚Äôt slow down it stops you from seeing thing you shouldn‚Äôt.  So does it work...  yes.  Are there issues, yes and there is with fancier stuff.  The question is do you have anything helping or blocking the crap that is so easily found on the internet.  For 40 bucks and 5 a month for circle go I think it‚Äôs worth it to have something.  And it‚Äôs the best value that I‚Äôve seen for what your getting.

title: Very disappointing...constant hassle
text:
Repeated issue with unmanaged devices (Nest thermostats, my wife‚Äôs work computer) losing internet connectivity over night, which could only be fixed by restarting the router. That‚Äôs why I turned it off and went back to OpenDNS and Qustodio. 

Usage is inaccurate. I continually had to extend the children‚Äôs time because Circle tracked everything. I tried to turning off background app refresh on what I could and marked sites as unmanaged (Dropbox, etc), but my kids would hit their usage while at school with no devices. Maybe this product is only good if you have a few devices. 

We are a smart home family so figuring out all the devices, naming them, and setting their permissions is a hassle. 

As far as I can tell, they set this up by device so everything on our iMac is one user. Qustodio is set up by user and is much more accurate. Qustodio is also more transparent. You can actually tell where kids have gone, what the searches for, etc. Circle usage history is mostly gibberish and hard to decipher. 

The Xbox has the same issue as the iMac. 

This product is for a very small and uncomplicated use case.

title: Maybe good for 3-year-olds?
text:
I'm a high school teen (15), and I know that most kids on here are just rating it very poorly because they hate it. But I actually think that this is useless. Circle blocks a lot of websites that should be accessed, and there is no easy way for the parents to quickly approve requests to unlock it. Unfortunately, it blocks too much to really be useful for a teen (even though there is a teen setting).

Circle Go is terrible. In the first day I had it, I bypassed it too easily. It also only sends the parents a notification after a day or when you pass bedtime. You can easily bypass Circle Go for an entire day, and then turn it on for the night. (By the way, you can bypass it by turning off "Connect on demand" in the VPN settings and make sure you turn it back on before bedtime üòâ)

Good for 3 year Olds.

title: High hopes but falls short
text:
I really really want to love this app... but I don‚Äôt.  I have both the regular ‚ÄúCircle‚Äù and ‚ÄúCircle Go‚Äù so that I can have control over all my kids devices. 
The software is buggy.  Sometimes it‚Äôs great and at other times it‚Äôs fairly worthless.  For example, right now it‚Äôs acting as if ‚ÄúCircle Go‚Äù is not on my kids phone when clearly it is.  I find that the Circle Go (phone) paid service is a bit more buggy than their regular Circle (internet) service. 
I have had to uninstall and reinstall the Circle Go service a few times on my kids phones. 
I still have hopes for this company/service but I‚Äôm paying for a service that should work more consistently.  At some point, I will have to look elsewhere if Circle doesn‚Äôt work put the bugs.

title: So far so good!
text:
We got this device to help protect our son and my husband from inappropriate things on the internet. We haven‚Äôt had a single issue with it so far and we are going on about 3 weeks now. We do notice a bit more things that show up in our browsing history that we didn‚Äôt go to, but it‚Äôs nothing major. Probably an issue with our router. 
We haven‚Äôt utilized the time limits or bed times just yet,  but we did opt in for the $4.99 a month subscription to Go. That way both of my boys are protected while off of our home WiFi. I‚Äôm not complaining! Thank you DisneyCircle.

title: Great product for wifi self awareness
text: I chuckle as I write this as some of the negative reviews might be written by children. This has helped our whole family be more aware of how much time we are on wifi. My children are not happy because they can't play Xbox until 3 am...but I can go to sleep better without having to take cords and electronic devices. They are unhappy but we are healthier since they are not on wifi for 12 hours daily....but I don't care. I'm the parent. It's my wifi that I pay for so then my rules.  I did have to tinker with it some. Love it. Even helps me unplug!!

title: What a great device for my family!
text: We have had circle at our home since beta testing and it's been amazing! I love how I can setup profiles for each of my children and control when and what they are able to view on their devices. Whether it's an iPad or an Xbox I can make sure my family is safe when connected. It's so easy these days to stumble upon something unwanted or inappropriate when your connected to the Internet. Circle helps have more control over all the wifi connected devices in my home and how they are being used.

title: Using for 1 month with moderate success
text: I think this could be great but still a lot of work needed. Works great on computer. Setting the time limit is effective but it only works for the entire device. No way to share devices with more than one person so we have to enforce time limits on the family computer manually as we have always done. We have one computer shared by adults and kids in our family.  If I‚Äôm doing computer work, I pause the Circle app so it doesn‚Äôt count my time as kid-time. Also doesn‚Äôt work on our tv at all. Maybe if you only use an internet based streaming tv service. But for satellite it appears to have no ability to control use. The filter seems to work pretty good for specific sites etc.

title: Nifty!
text: Isn't technology great!  I bet those parents from the 90's and oughts had this stuff.  I appreciate all you have accomplished.  The simplicity is key.  I am a tech pro and find this very refreshing. It is very simple (in application and in concept) to use.  For those that want grainular control down to the packet, go get your pro stuff.  This just works the way I want 99.5% of the time.  I even like how it notifies you when circle loses internet connection.  Helpful when not at home or logging when provider's have outages.   All in all it does what it advertises.   Keep up the good work and I look forward to new and improved features.

title: Simple to Use and Extremely Effective
text:
I was a beta user of this simple device and app and am now a happy customer.  It lets me protect my family online and also monitor usage across every device.  I can limit access to specific apps after certain times, set time limits and bedtimes, and keep track of how much time we‚Äôre spending on devices.

Best of all, it‚Äôs simple to use.  Before this, I was using a complicated filtering system that was more trouble than it‚Äôs worth. Circle has made it easy to monitor and create conversations.  Highly recommend this app.

title: Difficult to configure, time limit feature worthless
text:
I can‚Äôt imagine how hard it must be for a non-technical person to set this up. We had issues with streaming tv services & other things until we got every video device (some with cryptic identifiers) to ‚Äúunmanaged.‚Äù Even then, it took several restarts of both our appletv & Circle before it fully took effect.

In addition, the time limit feature is worthless. ‚ÄúOn time‚Äù accumulates as long as the device is powered & connected to the network, whether being used or not. iOS devices need to do updates, backups, & maintenance while networked, so shutting down between uses is bad practice as well as inconvenient.

title: Simple yet Powerful
text: I have used a couple different systems for filtering content, and they are complicated and clunky. I‚Äôm an IT professional so I don‚Äôt mind advanced setups. Circle is very simple. One of the biggest limitations of other home routers is that they couldn‚Äôt enforce safe search. Circle can!  I don‚Äôt use Circle for time management or for specific apps. I only use it for content filtering, so I can‚Äôt speak to the other features. IMO nothing replaces good old fashioned discipline and watchfulness when it comes to kids and electronic devices. This is just one tool that can add to that.

title: Doesn't do enough.
text: I really wanted to love Circle. I desperately need something to make the Internet and iPads safer for my kids AND to limit their screen time both on the Internet and off the Internet. Circle does a great job of filtering the Internet and limiting Internet time. But my kids just laugh at the time limits. They burn through their Internet time and then just hop on their non-Internet apps and play the day away. It still forces parents to micro manage screen time and fight with kids 24/7. To make matters worse, I thought I would supplement Circle with an app that does track ALL app time and not just Internet app time like Circle. But the two apps conflict and won't work with each other.

title: Surprisingly not very good from Disney
text: I got Circle as part of the Netgear Nighthawk router.  Im not sure if it is a app problem or hardware problem? But like others mention, yes this is very very buggy and a 2.4 star rating is warranted. I will give a three. It seems the app is not connected more than it is connected. I have logged into app for a check of where my 14yr old has been on the WWW and it doesnt connect. Then I have to go reboot router. Then it comes up but 70% of the time will then kick someone off (and not because of my parameters set) or will disconnect for no reason. Then i go reboot again. This surprises me as I would assume something from Disney would be spot-on and top-notch like their parks.

title: Good and bad. Can‚Äôt get support.
text: Once I set up the product worked pretty well for a while, although it does not have all the features I would‚Äôve wanted. It was annoying to set up, because it was hard to tell the name of many devices. Printers, smart home, many other devices don‚Äôt come with any name or are misleading. That is not their fault, but it‚Äôs strange that this is supposed to work with my Netgear Orbi, but it doesn‚Äôt see the same names that Netgear knows. The big problem I had after a few months, was all of my profile information disappeared. I had to start over from scratch, which is a big pain. I couldn‚Äôt find a phone number for support, but found a link to a form. I filled it out but never heard back.

title: Want to love it
text:
The features this have are far more robust than most apps I‚Äôve seen like this.  For example, tagging devices to users and aggregating time spent across all devices.  This seems like such a no- rained to me, but few others do it.  Unfortunately, Circle interferes with our Verizon Fios router and completely removes the info in the channel guide on the set top boxes.  I‚Äôve spent over an hour on the phone with Verizon and the only thing that would get the boxes working properly again was disconnecting Circle.  After doing that, we went a few months without Circle and hooked it back up again in hopes that it‚Äôd work.  Sure enough, after a couple days all the info in the guide was blank again.  

Great concept, but not well executed.

title: Website Filtering Only
text: I‚Äôm using the basic feature of website filtering and do not plan to subscribe for the premium features.  I‚Äôm am currently using Microsoft Famly to set time restrictions for my children‚Äôs computer usage, which also works if they are offline.  Plus the feature from Microsoft was a one-time fee of 50 cents.  Otherwise I am satisfied with the filtering capabilities of the service which came with my Netgear router.  Although this seems a bit redundant as I believe Netgear also includes their own web filtering features with the same router.

title: It Semi-Works
text: The biggest gripe I have with the circle app is how long it takes to just load. Once you open it, you sit and sit and sit some more while it does whatever it‚Äôs doing. Even on the same network, or having the main device hard lined, it takes a good minute and a half just to login. When you do anything inside the app it‚Äôs like it‚Äôs computing pi to 10,000 decimal places each time, it‚Äôs just slow.... you would think that with all the monthly fees and hardware costs, that they‚Äôd at least get the app right... nope. With all that said, it does work and it does block about 95% of what it should. It for sure needs work, hopefully they will resolve the issues we‚Äôve been having. Not like there‚Äôs another option out there, which is probably why they aren‚Äôt in any rush.

title: Foreign website filters are too restrictive
text: I have 4 children in my household, two of them learning a foreign language in High School (Chinese). Naturally Chinese language websites are a big part of their homework- however even though I had all my children at the ‚ÄòTeen‚Äô Filter level, Circle blocks almost all Chinese websites- and even when I reset them to ‚ÄòAdult‚Äô quite a few Chinese websites were being blocked by the filter. This is ridiculous- China already does an excellent job filtering their content, there‚Äôs no need for Circle to be blocking 90% of Chinese websites.

title: Waste for older kids who you really need it for
text: I was hoping this would actually help in in my efforts to filter what my kids use on their phones and to monitor how much time they get to use their phones when I am not physically there to remove them from their hands. It took my kids less than 30 mins to figure out the work around and then my phone was blowing up with notifications that circle had been disabled on someone‚Äôs phone. I have decided that there are zero apps or programs that can help me control phone time. My only option is to physically remove the phones from their possession. (If developers would like to see if their programs have any work arounds or can be hacked in any way, give my 4 kids 10 mins with it. If they can‚Äôt do it then you have a winner)

title: Absolutely dissatisfied.
text: Never again would i get this product. It was a complete waste of money. My children hate me so much and wont even speak to me. It seemed appealing at first, knowing I would have complete control of what my kids were doing, but know I now that you don‚Äôt need that. I have realized that your children need at least a little tiny bit of privacy. I understand buying this product if you know your children are naughty and just want to see what they are doing, but getting this when you know you‚Äôre children are good, is useless. Actually one of my children ran away from our home one night because it was too much. I now understand why. Let your kids be kids. Trust them. You dont need to waste $100 on an app to see that your kids are a wonder.

title: Stellar!
text: I've tried multiple SaaS offerings  for managing kids devices at home such iPads, Win10pcs, and this app and its setup have been the fastest and easiest! As a tech dad this was the best app and endpoint device  I've tried and I love that I can use it when home or remote. The ability to group devices that are existing or new to your home network makes this so simple to deploy and organize objects. This saved me hundreds of dollars a year with our kids by not having to pay for services from WebWatcher and others! I highly recommend this!!

title: Easy to setup & works very well
text:
It was a breeze to setup the device and the profiles. Works very well than any other device based filtering programs. Looks like a lot of kids are trying to dissuade parents from getting it based on some reviews. Didn't see any speed issues, although I connected directly to the router with cable.

Does require that each device be assigned to one user. Not an issue with most devices. With laptops with multiple accounts, I chose the most restrictive setting.

title: The app needs some work
text: I was really excited for the app, but it struggles.  I‚Äôd set a bedtime and the app would shut down the network an hour before.  I thought perhaps it was a time zone thing, but never did find where I could adjust the time zone.  I would disable time restrictions and the network would still shut down.  I reset to factory settings, i re-established our circle and then the next day while I was at work, the network shut down.  I opened the app to unpause the network and the app no longer recognized my circle.   At this point, the app is too much of a hassle.  I just wanted the thing to work, but I‚Äôm no longer willing to pay for this headache.  I‚Äôm sad that Disney has its name on the app.

title: Parents please consider this before getting it for your child
text: As a teenager, writing this I have a biased view of course. I personally think that the my circle is stupid and is a way for protective parents to be even more protective of their children. The my circle has helicopter parents written all over it. If you are a kid and reading this do everything you can to ensure that your parents do NOT get my circle. I have gotten into countless fights with my parents over how stupid this can be. It has definitely caused problems between me and my parents. Parents if your my circle gets smashed one day you can only blame yourself for torturing your kids. As a teen I think that I am responsible enough to make intelligent decisions without the help of a device that monitors me 24/7.

title: Great Sometimes, Extremely Frustrating Others
text:
I feel like every other day it messes up & typically when it‚Äôs most inconvenient to my husband and I. Some of the things that are constantly happening are, it may say it‚Äôs bedtime at 11am or similar time sensitive settings, kids are out of time but they‚Äôve been on 15 min & general time inconsistencies like that, it deletes many of the settings we created for each child. We have to delete the whole profile of each child and start over many times. 
These aren‚Äôt that laborious tasks but this is a PAID for App & is no longer new. FIX THIS STUFF OR HIRE SOMEONE WHO CAN, plus reduce the rate and refund something to those of us sticking it out. Or we are done here. üé§Drop

title: Terrible App ‚Äì Will lock up phone!!!
text: I have spent a month speaking with Wesley trying to undo all the problems this app has caused on my son‚Äôs phone. It started with phantom time usage ‚Äì brought his phone to work, all apps closed, and mid-day it said he used up all his time. Finally disabled Circle, deleted Circle Go from his phone and deleted primary app for my device, and he still gets the Circle ‚Äútime limit up‚Äù message when trying to use safari. Additionally, he has been unable to access the App Store for 26 days, despite suggestions made to rectify the problem. Idea is great, maybe someone will actually put it into practice one day because this app is no where near ready for consumer use. Hard to believe Disney would put their name on something like this.

title: Disappointed
text: I really wanted to like this app.  I got Circle free due to having an Orbi NETGEAR system in my home.  I found the set up a bit lengthy for what it was purported to do on the basic/free level but I kept it.  I found it was not really working well and blocking sites for my 9 year old that it should not.  Then when I went to delete the app/his account from Circle, it still was blocking his devices from accessing certain pages.  I finally had to redownload the app, change his profile to all access and only then did it stop blocking sites.  I‚Äôve ultimately decided I don‚Äôt need an app to parent for me and my son‚Äôs internet usage.  If I cannot take the time to invest in my child and be active and monitor his usage, then I have to question my parenting skills in general.

title: üëéüèª
text: In all, the my circle and circle app needs improvements. First, it slows down your WiFi and makes all the devices slower because of one box. Next, it seems like it could be showing false information because it said I was on twitter when I don‚Äôt even have a Twitter account. The app was wrong and it shows false things. Finally, it said I was on my phone for 20 minutes one time when I was only on it for 5 minutes. It purposely says you were on it longer to speed up your time limit and use it all up so your phone can shut down. Also, the my circle app is really cheesy and needs to be friendly for all ages because it seems like it‚Äôs aimed for 6 year olds. I don‚Äôt like the idea of circle so please improve it. It is not worth $100.

title: Cool app but doesn‚Äôt work as advertised
text:
App is great, you can add all your family members and see who logs on and off when people visit. I like that you can freeze online for everyone.

Here‚Äôs what I don‚Äôt like. The app doesn‚Äôt tell you how long someone is online for, so it‚Äôs actually unfair and cruel to put a limit on a child when their phones by default use data when not in use.  Over night, our phones sometimes use data by certain apps like weather, email, internal computations etc.. 

So when we wake up, Circle would state everyone in my family used 2-3 hours overnight when we were actually sleeping. Going to delete after free trial.  Hopefully Apple makes their own version.

title: Save your money time & loads of frustration
text: At first, I thought how fantastic!  I can monitor my children‚Äôs devices from one app.  but all it has led to is slowing down our entire households connections, spotty connection of itself & many times I‚Äôm get notifications that it‚Äôs not connected to the internet. So what good is it? The kids can just turn off their WiFi & use their 4G to access internet & no monitoring from circle can be in place. Waste of money, time setting it up & figuring out whose device belongs to what & what setting needs to be in place all for nothing. I even tried the circle go to see if that would be better (additional $5 per month) & no difference at all except I‚Äôve thrown away more $ to a service that does me no service.

title: Works great
text:
I have this app for about a month. It does what I need to. Yes, I can block by app, by time, etc. From a few I have used in the past, this actually blocks on the way I need to. My kids get mad with us, yes, but I do need to control their electronics usage. Learn to use it effectively is a key point, set the rules with your children so there is no disagreement. 

One single bug I have found, occasionally it would lost all your configuration. I have fixed by disabling the parental control and re-enabled right back on and reopening the application. To me that is not such a big deal. 

My children kind of like it too, because if they do their homework on time they can get rewarded.

The only other app that might be as robust and accurate is the one that comes with the modem/router rental. So, I choose to have control of my network.

title: Love the Circle, don‚Äôt like the app
text: I work in Cybersecurity so I wanted something to protect my kids. Disney Circle is affordable and relatively easy to set up. I knew it was working when my teen came down and asked what we had done to the network. üòã  Unfortunately it‚Äôs gone downhill since then. It‚Äôs become very unintuitive to administer and the app keeps crashing. I‚Äôm trying to set up filters to allow my kids to use their school devices on our network, but that keeps crashing too. I‚Äôve had to put them on the ‚Äúopen‚Äù network to connect to their school, completely negating the need for this product. I can‚Äôt find anything to help me resolve this issue either. What happened?!?!

title: Not Ready for Distribution
text:
First off, I'm a kid, but I won‚Äôt be rambling on about how much I hate this thing. i‚Äôll try to be as objective as possible.

There are lots of bugs in this product which make your kid(s) life more of a hellhole than it already is. This thing makes your internet slow as a snail, so I can‚Äôt even maximize on the very little time  allotted to my profile. Worse, I don‚Äôt even get all of the internet time assigned to my profile for some stupid reason. Circle Go is pretty much useless, all you need to do is turn off one setting.

If I were a parent, I would just talk with my child and try to figure out a solution together, or telling them my own feelings. Honestly, this product is for 8-year-old kids who play too much Roblox.

title: When it works, it works great
text:
Circle does what we need it to, usually.  Features are great and profile setup is easy.  Identifying all devices on your network takes time when you only have the MAC address to work from. 

Many times though the Circle cannot be found by the app.  Just waiting a while makes it found - Several  app resets later.  A few times a day the app sends a notification that circle is offline, then Online a bit later. We‚Äôve had to reboot it 5 times in 25 days when it wouldn‚Äôt respond at all.  We have 5 days left to decide if we are returning it.  On the fence.

title: It just stopped working
text: I have had this app for not even a few weeks and it started out just fine. I got all my devices added, assigned to a profile and was using the app with no problem. Then two days ago it just stopped working and would not connect.  It gives me an option to ‚ÄúTry again‚Äù or ‚ÄúPair‚Äù to a new circle.  I have repeatedly tried to ‚Äútry again‚Äù but it does nothing. I went to their support page and did everything they said but nothing worked. The only thing left to do is to pair it again which basically means I have to start again.  Not impressed! Hopefully if I redo this I won‚Äôt have to keep doing it every week.

title: DONT DOWNLOAD THIS APP!!!üò°
text: My parents got this for me and my younger siblings, and I am absolutely DISGUSTED in this app. ITS TERRIBLE!!!! Sure, I understand my two younger siblings who are nine and six, they don‚Äôt know better and they aren‚Äôt as  mindful about their internet usage. But older kids on the other hand, (Like ME. I am literally 12 and about to be 13 very soon) We are responsible and we have enough knowledge to know when enough is enough. Also, kids like us at our age are getting to a point in their life where they are starting to grow up to be the mature adult they will be one day. One trait every adult needs is independence. Without it, how would be be the fully functioning adults that the society needs? This app is only an app to micro-manage your internet time and usage.

title: Crashes *UPDATE*
text: After repeated crashes, I contacted customer support by email.  Expecting it to take 72 hours to respond, I deleted and  reinstalled the app and it solved the problem. To my surprise, less than 3 hours after I sent the email, customer support responded with a solution. I'll save the email in case the app crashes again because the theory is it might crash if your child overuses the system and it becomes backlogged. Otherwise, Circle is a must for parents. Absolutely outstanding and intuitive.  Full range of controls and superb notifications.

title: I found a way out of this
text:
Attention all kids/teens getting your device locked. I found a way around this. Your parents/guardians circle has to be plugged into an outlet, if not if will slowly over time power off. This means it has to be in at an outlet. Step 1) find the location where it‚Äôs at.
Step 2) the side with the plug in and light can be removed. Carefully using a flathead screwdriver or butter knife stick around the edge of the plastic slide down then up it should come lose. 
Step 3) take off the top (keeps all wires attached) and look for two cords streaming from a blue box (battery) into a circuit. 
Step 4) final step, disconnect the cord from the circuit and then push both ends together. It will look like nothing ever happened.

title: A little help here...
text: Overall I believe this is a superb app. However, I have two boys who play PubG (another form of FortNite) and the platform isn‚Äôt found under child or teen settings. I downloaded the app myself and can‚Äôt control it. I‚Äôve found it isn‚Äôt showing up under Online Gaming which I have limited per day. It‚Äôs under Science and Technology...but even though I get a notification they‚Äôve met their max time limit, it doesn‚Äôt boot them off. This was the main reason I purchased the app. Please advise. I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôm not the only person with this issue.

title: Ok. When it works.
text: The controls and filters are good enough. When they work. I have created various groups with the policies needed at my house. It works great for a day or two. Then devices move randomly out of their assigned profile into the unmonitored profile. I‚Äôve the app just on my phone with password and Touch ID so I know no one is manually changing anything. Unfortunately there‚Äôs no log or monitor function to know what‚Äôs  happening. Also looking at how long it‚Äôs been since an app update makes me think this app is on the way to be abandoned.

title: Not very good unless you are trying to block parents
text:
My daughter can still watch anything she wants and quickly found a work around. However, my wife and I are blocked from the internet and keep getting a ‚Äúmeet circle‚Äù page. 
I use my phone for my business and had no access till I disabled Circle. Now I am too scared to enable it again and affect my business.
There is no support from Circle other than a frequently asked page. I am sure this thing works as it is advertised but it is to complicated for my family. I‚Äôm sure if I gave it to my daughter she would figure out how to set it up perfectly, but that is not it‚Äôs purpose.

title: Works occasionally
text: Circle is a great idea for those who don't have access to their modem interface to do the same kind of thing. The problem is that Circle seems to pick and choose when it's going to work.  If I set a time limit for my daughter for a half hour, it will often tell me she's reached her 15 minute time limit (when I set it for 30) and then it keeps going anyway past the 15 and then past the 30 until I step in (which I do).  It kind of makes the whole thing moot. I would pay maybe $20 for it, but for $100 it is definitely not worth it.  Just go back to the old fashioned way of monitoring screen and device time.

title: There‚Äôs potential...
text:
The interface for the app is great. We would like to be able to select what apps to allow or refuse like how OurPact works. We really like how it totals up screen time for all devices for each person.  You can create parent accounts but the parent accounts aren‚Äôt secured once you are in the app. We would like that level of security added.

Had this for a week and we had to restart our network three times either to get access or restrict access.

Looking forward to updates and more consistently with this product. It has really great potential.

title: Great solution
text: If the Kids are under 18 in the USA, this is a great device to see how your Home Internet is being used and it assists with keeping your network secure by notifying you when an unknown device connects up.  You can block 80 to 90% of objectionable content that depending on your view under 18 year-olds should be restricted from for their own good... It only works for your broadband network and not cell device networking.  Kids may get highly upset on how effectively it works...

title: Probably the best device for managing kids time
text:
I have the Disney Circle, not the Netgear version. I have tried multiple solutions for managing my kids internet time, and this is by far the best system.

I find most of the complaints here actually irritating and nit picky. No system is perfect, I have tried many from installing open source software to other paid solutions, and this is the easiest to manage. And to the comments about it being easy to hack, seriously? If you have half an eye open you would spot it in the usage stats on the app.

Granted making your kids online fit takes a holistic approach, but the circle has taken a massive weight off filtering internet content, and internet time management. 

My advice buy it, it‚Äôs worth the time you will save as your household network admin.

title: Works great most the time
text:
I was easily able to get devices set up. However, if I didn‚Äôt know how to find MAC/wifi address I could have struggled some. I was a little surprised how many devices we have connected!

I‚Äôve got to reboot every couple of days. I don‚Äôt know how much of this is the circle or my internet. We had issues with our internet prior, it‚Äôs gotten a bit more troublesome. I think the next time I‚Äôm going to connect directly to router with Ethernet to see if that helps. 

That said - I love that I can pause the access with an app. I like that I can see where my kids are going online and what apps they are using. That there is no longer a bedtime hunt to locate devices - after a certain time it‚Äôs off. 

We are also using the recommended chore apps. The kids love being able to earn extra screen time, and have been more helpful with less arguments!

title: Value for the money spent
text: Excellent device + app to control internet usage on a per app basis while the child is on WiFi. Recommend using it along with the parental controls offered by the cellular provider (e.g. AT&T, I have disabled cellular data for my child) so that WiFi is the only way to access internet. Of course, you will not be able to control the WiFi use at school or Starbucks etc. I didn‚Äôt go with Circle GO because it would be easy to disable the VPN.

title: Product and App do No Work
text: I had high hopes for this product and app.  Unfortunately, Circle and the app simply do not work, at least not for more than a few hours.  Even if you are lucky enough to have it works for a few hours, the time limits that are set are not enforced, making it virtually useless.  In addition, when the circle app decides to randomly turn off, it takes your whole wifi network down with it.  After many, many attempts to reset the wifi and to pair again with circle, only to have it repeatedly fail after 10 minutes or a few hours, it is clear that Circle does not live up to its promises. Do not waste your time or money on this product.

title: Service level agreement changed- will not continue
text:
We have had circle for at least 2 years- that being said we liked it and it was meeting our needs. We started experiencing connection issues and upon investigation realized we needed to perform a firm wear upgrade/update. This then led us to a choice to now pay for the same service that we had which is not what we had planned on. Original purchase and service included the basic monitoring. 
We will no longer be using the circle and have pursued other alternatives due to the requirements to pay.

title: Disney at its stupidest
text:
MyCircle is a complete money-hungry scam, they charge $100 just for the device, then make me pay monthly just to use it, and worst of all, my kids have unlimited data and never even have to use WiFi so it is COMPLETELY useless, also, my kids have found easy ways to hack into MyCircle, such as disconnecting the home
WiFi, and can change their settings to whatever they want! DO NOT BUY! This thing is way overpriced and it basically does nothing. Think of it as throwing money in the trash and getting nothing in return. In conclusion, I hope Apple removes this terrible app and I hope everyone reading this will not buy into this scam Disney has set up just to make a quick buck.

title: Circle Review
text: Okay, the MyCircle is a decent way to track internet usage, but the pressure it puts on your relationships with kids is too much. When I was little, Disney meant Disneyland, Princesses, and fun nights out with family watching an old classic on the big screen. Nowadays, it means my kids yelling at me to add more time and getting angry over not being able to text friends. Overall, Circle is a good idea, but the execution could be better. Maybe try adding a way for kids to earn ‚Äútokens‚Äù by spending time off screens. ‚ÄúTokens‚Äù could be used to have certain Disney characters appear, or, with parents‚Äô permission, be able to get more time.

title: Wish it wasn't so buggy
text: Ben using this app for a couple days now and it seems like it gets confused on what device views what website because it showed a items on my daughter's history that was from my history so it's hard to trust it.  Also missing about 2hrs of history from this morning when I know the device was online.    I think it definitely has potential but a of now it needs some serious attention.

title: Kids aren‚Äôt stupid
text: To all parents you gotta understand that unless you specialize specifically in Software Security your kids are most likely smarter then you with computers and they due to their increased intelligence in this field will always find a workaround let it be a Virtual Portal Network (VPN) or they decide to watch a 5 minute video on how to use command prompt they‚Äôll find a way past this so this is not only useless but a waste of time I instead would probably invest your time in teaching them the importance of internet Safety. I for one know a 10 year old that looked up on the internet what ‚Äúcircle‚Äù was and within 5 minutes already discovers a workaround so his mom and dad couldn‚Äôt pause his Fortnite.

title: App needs a lot of work. My child was able to replace my acct
text:
They need to have a web browser login and not force everything to work off an app. The interface is not as intuitive when stepping thru set up especially restrictions.
I have family share on all our IOS devices and app downloaded to my kids phone and he was able to get on My account page and change login. And I didn‚Äôt not get any notification or two factor authentication request to my phone. 

I try to reset settings and get general failure . Go on suport site and it‚Äôs F$&@ ‚Äúcircular‚Äù !!!. Go and try find support contact or email. It will take you to page that directs you back to list of FAQs. Are you serious!!!???

title: All sorts of issues
text:
Update Oct 23. continuing to have issues with Circle Go.  I am tired of trying to fix it and have given up. Still get notifications that Circle Go has been uninstalled from phone when it is still on the phone. Circle interferes with phone performance and we have to remove the vpn and then reinstall it again so that it works correctly.  

I am beyond frustrated with your product. Circle Go isn't working at all and is blocking my kids IPhone all day.  It interferes with the speed of the iPhone as well.  I have spoken to your customer support many times. You need to take a look at your software and stop telling the user that it is our problem!

title: Fantastic! No Problems Whatsoever
text: Love this device and its accompanying app. Just what I needed to monitor my kids devices. Not sure why so many others are having issues with their internet after pairing the device. I've had no issues at all. Tested internet with speedtest pre and post install. No changes. Device is very easy to hook up. The app is intuitive and super easy to use. Highly recommend. Don't let a few negative reviews scare you.

title: Switched to subscription w/o warning. Lost everything
text:
So this was a cute piece of hardware, promised some control and no subscription fees. And it was a semi-effective tracking tool for usage of electronics in our house. 

Then last weekend it wiped everything and rebooted.. now having to PAY for the services. It makes no sense. AND I lost all my settings!! Do you have any IDEA how many electronic devices are connected to the WiFi in a family of 6? It took me MONTHS to identify the devices based on the vague names, lump them into categories, set bedtime and screen time cutoffs for each. 

All gone without warning and now I have to pay monthly.

title: I don‚Äôt even know anymore
text: We have this because my mom doesn‚Äôt want us staying up too late, but this is just getting terrible my mom set it up to turn internet off at 12am but on mine it turns it off on 11:00 and my brothers crap works all night long and my stuff doesn‚Äôt work ever this has been slowing down our internet speed also and overall if you would like to torture your kids and make them hate you get this (never freaking get this piece of crap) ALSO THE DEVELOPER RESPONSES ARE TERRIBLE I read a review that said that it is making there kids hate them and the developer response said that this is the type of comment we like to see and that your circle must be working

title: Bad reviews clearly written by upset kids
text: It is very clear the bad reviews of this product are kids upset they now have limits set for them on their devices. They even go so far as to pretend to be adults or ‚Äúnetwork experts‚Äù. I am a relatively tech savvy adult and love this product. It is made quite well and simple to use, and gives great reporting on usage. I am sure it is not a perfect product, but when talking about privacy and security nothing is perfect.

title: Losing connection
text: Love the app overall. Biggest ongoing problem is that occasionally the app loses connection to my Circle enabled router when I am away from my house.  At that point I lose control of the router and cannot reconnect until I get home.  For example right now I am away from my home for two days.  I turned off internet to my son‚Äôs devices for a while. The the Circle lost the connection. Now I can‚Äôt turn it back on until I get home tomorrow night.  This is a serious problem.
